title: Twenty Thousand Leagues Under the Sea
creator: Paton
description: When their ship crashes near a mysterious island, Professor Aronnax and his crew encounter an astonishing underwater world created by Captain Nemo, who traveled over 20,000 leagues to look for his missing daughter.
subject: early cinema; adventure

title: A Man There Was
creator: Sjostrom
description: A man loses his family to the British and suffers as a POW during the Napoleonic Wars. Years after the end of the war he finds his British captor in need of help. Instead of vengence he chooses forgiveness and rescues the British captain and his family.  The film was shot in the many islands of Stockholm Archipelago; in the film, the island is described only as "uttermost and barren."
subject: melodrama; golden age of Swedish silent cinema

title: Man of the Sea
creator: L’Herbier
description: L'Homme du large explores themes of forgiveness and repentance in a melodrama about a Breton fisherman.
subject: French impressionism; early cinema

title: Man of the Sea
creator: L’Herbier
description: L'Homme du large explores themes of forgiveness and repentance in a melodrama about a Breton fisherman.
subject: French impressionism; early cinema

title: Nanook of the North
creator: Flaherty
description: This documentary (although largely staged) follows an Inuk family (Nanook and his family) live and perform daily tasks during a winter in the Ungava Peninsula of Quebec, Canada. The film portrays them as relentless heroes, their lifestyle exotic, and their environment unforgiving.
subject: documentary; ethongraphy

title: Cœur Fidéle
creator: Epstein
description: Cœur Fidéle is a melodrama about Marie and her tragic romance, set against the docks of Marseilles. The film features iconic techniques of photogénie, many of which involve images of water combined with the cross-dissolve.
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; early cinema

title: La Belle Nivernaiase
creator: Epstein
description: The titular canal flows from the city of Auxerre, in the Burgundy region southeast to Paris, to Decize, a city in Central France, connectig the Yonne river and the Loire river. The Canal du Nivernais is Epstein made La Belle Nivernaise in 1923, the same year he filmed Cœur fidéle. The film is an adaptation of a short story written by Alphonse Daudet and tells the story of an orphan boy growing up by the river.
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; early cinema

title: La Belle Nivernaiase
creator: Epstein
description: The titular canal flows from the city of Auxerre, in the Burgundy region southeast to Paris, to Decize, a city in Central France, connectig the Yonne river and the Loire river. The Canal du Nivernais is Epstein made La Belle Nivernaise in 1923, the same year he filmed Cœur fidéle. The film is an adaptation of a short story written by Alphonse Daudet and tells the story of an orphan boy growing up by the river.
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; early cinema

title: Kœnigsmark
creator: Perret
description: An adaptation of the 1917 novel of the same title, Kœnigsmark is a story about a schoolteacher who discovers a crime. The filmmaker insisted on creating a faithful adaptation to the original novel and therefore filming in Germany: the film was, at least partially, shot near the Neuschwanstein Castle (which can be seen in the film).
subject: early cinema

title: The Great White Silece
creator: Ponting
description: Photographer Herbert Ponting accompanied British explorer Captain Falcon Scott to the British Antartic Expedition (1910-1913, also called the Terra Nova expedition) to the South Pole. After showing the expedition crew sailing into the Southern Ocean and preparing to move towards the South Pole, the film ends with a sequene of the crew leaving their base, followed by title cards that explain that Scott and the explorers never returned from the Pole.
subject: early cinema; documentary

title: La Glace à trois faces
creator: Epstein
description: Three women are in love with one man. An early work by Epstein, the film shows the usual techinques of camera movement and superimposition by the director. The film was shot in Paris and in the town of L'Isle-Adam by the river Oise.
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; early cinema

title: La Chute de la maison Usher
creator: Epstein
description: Perhaps the best known film by Epstein, La Chute de la maison Usher tells the story of Usher through his friend, an unknown narrator. The film is an adaptation of two short stories by Poe.  The film was shot in three different locations: the interior in Studios Éclair and Menchen in Épinay-sur-Seine near Paris; the exteriors in Sologne (with the river Sologne) and Vexin (a historical region in northern France).
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; early cinema

title: La Chute de la maison Usher
creator: Epstein
description: Perhaps the best known film by Epstein, La Chute de la maison Usher tells the story of Usher through his friend, an unknown narrator. The film is an adaptation of two short stories by Poe.  The film was shot in three different locations: the interior in Studios Éclair and Menchen in Épinay-sur-Seine near Paris; the exteriors in Sologne (with the river Sologne) and Vexin (a historical region in northern France).
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; early cinema

title: Maldone
creator: Gremillon
description: Maldone is a story about a man who runs away from his estate, becomes a canal worker, and finds love, only to be called back home and marry a different woman. The film notes the waterway as the Briare Canal and its Saint-Jean lock (which does not exist; most similar is Saint Joseph lock).
subject: French impressionism; early cinema;

title: The Bridge
creator: Ivens
description: This experimental documentary short is a montage of close-ups of the then-newly built Koningshaven Bridge (Koninginnebrug / "De Hef") in Rotterdam and the trains and ships that pass by it, in the backdrop of which is seen the port of Rotterdam.
subject: experimental; documentary

title: Steamboat Bill Jr.
creator: Keaton and Reisner
description: Buster Keaton plays Bill Canfield Jr., or Steamboat Jr.: an awkward and eccentric son of Bill Canfield who owns a paddle steamer and is slowly losing business to a newer steamer. The film follows Bill Jr.'s visit home that is filled with mishaps but eventually helps his father and his business. The film is set to be in River Junction, MS, while Bill Jr., is based in Boston. The film production took place on a set in Sacramento; John Bengtson of silentlocations.com, crediting historian Paul Frobose, provides some shot-by-shot comparisons between map coordinates and the landmarks identified in the film (https://silentlocations.com/2011/04/18/buster-keaton-steamboat-bill-jr-locations/). Also see Jennifer Fay's discussion of the production process in The Inhospitable Planet.
subject: comedy, early cinema, Keaton, cyclone

title: Sea Urchins
creator: Painlevé
description: A close-up look at sea urchins.
subject: experimental; documentary, animal

title: Finis Terrae
creator: Epstein
description: Finis Terrae marks the beginning of Epstein's repeated visits to Brittany. The film tells the simple story of two young kelp farmers on the islet of Bannec, near Ouessant.
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; early cinema

title: Finis Terrae
creator: Epstein
description: Finis Terrae marks the beginning of Epstein's repeated visits to Brittany. The film tells the simple story of two young kelp farmers on the islet of Bannec, near Ouessant.
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; early cinema

title: Rain
creator: Ivens
description: Regan is an experimental documentary that shows the city of Amsterdam before, during, and after a rainfall. The premiere of the film was held in De Ulitkijk, the theater of the Amsterdam Filmliga (now a hotel).
subject: Documentary; city symphony; experimental

title: H2O
creator: Steiner
description: H2O is a cine-poem that shows water in its many different forms, made by photographer Ralph Steiner.
subject: Documentary; experimental; photography
source: National Film Registry (Library of Congress), https://www.loc.gov/item/2023600533/

title: Mor'Vran
creator: Epstein
description: Subtitled "La Mer des corbeaux" (sea of crows), Mor'Vran is part documentary, part fiction film that portrays the many faces of life on the islands of Sein and Brest by loosely following a sailor (and his misfortunes).
subject: Documentary; French impressionism;

title: Labor on the Douro River
creator: Oliveira
description: A short documentary about the laborers working in the city of Porto, around the river Douro.
subject: Documentary

title: Surf and Seaweed
creator: Steiner
description: Made a couple of years after H2O, Surf and Seaweed focuses on ocean tides swirling and surging, carrying seaweed and leaving marks on the soft sand.
subject: Documentary; cine-poem; experimental

title: Jean Taris, Swimming Champion
creator: Vigo
description: A short documentary about the swimmer Jean Taris, featuring Vigo's novel techniques that highlight the swimmer's moving body. It was filmed mostly at the Automobile Club of France in Paris.
subject: Documentary

title: L'Or des mers
creator: Epstein
description: L'or des mer tells the story of an old Breton fisherman who finds a box of treasure from a washed up shipwreck.
subject: French impressionism

title: Les Berceaux
creator: Epstein
description: Epstein experimented with metaphors and sound in this short film featuring Sully Prudhomme's poem set to the music of Gabriel Faure
subject: phonogenie; French impressionism; experimental

title: Boudu Saved From Drowning
creator: Renoir
description: Renoir's 1932 social satire film: Boudu, saved from drowning in River Seine by a middle class family and is given a second chance at a new life, challenges the newly learned manners and transgresses all rules. The film starts as Boudu takes a suicidal jump into the Seine from Pont des Arts.
subject: social realism; satire

title: The Water Magician [Taki no shiraito]
creator: Mizoguchi
description: A young woman is a travelling performer with a water-juggling act. She falls in love with a carriage driver. The film is still occasionally shown with a live benshi narration.
subject: melodrama;

title: Japanese Girls at the Harbor 港の日本娘, Minato no nihon musume
creator: Shimizu
description: Two schoolgirls drift apart when one of them falls for a boy with a motorcycle.
subject: melodrama;

title: The Seahorse
creator: Painlevé
description: A close look at the reproductive cycle of seahorses.
subject: documentary; science; animal

title: Chanson d’Ar-mor
creator: Epstein
description: Known as the first Breton-language film in history, Chanson d'Ar-mor is a poetic story of a Breton fisherman's impossible romance.
subject: French impressionism; photogenie;

title: Man of Aran
creator: Flaherty
description: Man of Aran is a fictional documentary about the people living on the Aran Islands off the western coast of Ireland. Much of the film is a fabrication: for example, the family members are unrelated; the fishermen were not in danger.
subject: Documentary; ethnography; surrealism

title: L’Atlante
creator: Vigo
description: Jean and Juliette's story. One can see the face of one's true love in the water.
subject: French impressionism; photogenie;
location: Bassin de la Villette, Paris, France

title: By the Bluest of Seas
creator: Barnet
description: A romantic comedy about a love triangle in an enchanted Soviet Azerbaijani island in the Caspian Sea
subject: Drama, Musical, romantic comedy

title: La Bretagne
creator: Epstein
description: Documetary about Breton culture
subject: documentary

title: The Wave (Redes)
creator: Muriel and Zinneman
description: Story about the fishing community of Alvarado on the Gulf Coast of Mexico
subject: neorealism; non-professional cast

title: A Day in the Country
creator: Renoir
description: A city family from Paris goes on a picnic to the nearby countryside; an adaptation of a Maupassant short story.
subject: drama; social realism;

title: Showboat
creator: Whale
description: Adaptation of a Broadway musical: story of performers on a Mississippi river boat.
subject: romantic comedy; musical

title: La Femme du bout du monde
creator: Epstein
description: Looking for a radium ore in Antartic Ocean, the crew instead finds a Breton woman and a series of murders and suicides.
subject: French impressionism; photogenie;

title: The River
creator: Lorentz
description: A depression-era documentary about the Mississippi River and the problems created by farming and timber practices in the region
subject: documentary

title: Undersea Fantasy
creator: Rossellini
description: Fish in love
subject: Documentary; animal;

title: Remorques
creator: Gremillon
description: An ordinary and content tugboat captain finds himself in a volatile romantic situation. The film was shot on location in Brest and at the Billancourt Studios in Paris.
subject: drama;

title: Moods of the Sea
creator: Hoffman and Vorkapic
description: An experimental film set to Mendelssohn's music and portraying the ocean.
subject: documentary; avant-garde; experimental

title: Swamp Water
creator: Renoir
description: A man encounters a fugitive and his daughter while hunting in the Okefenokee Swamp.
subject: noir; crime;

title: Ornamental Hairpin
creator: Shimizu
description: A quiet comedy / drama about a group of people at a spa where a potential romance begins.
subject: comedy; drama
location: rural Japan, possibly somewhere in the Izu Peninsula

title: Under the Bridges
creator: Kautner
description: A story about two Havel boatsmen and their romances. The film was shot in 1944 but was not released until after the fall of Nazi Germany.
subject: drama

title: At Land
creator: Deren
description: An experimental short film about exploring your inner world and finding your identity
subject: experimental; avant-garde;
location: Amagasett, Long Island, New York, USA

title: People of the Po Valley
creator: Antonioni
description: A short documentary on the people of the Po Valley follows a barge trip down the Po river. The film was shot near Ferrara.
subject: documentary

title: Le Tempestaire
creator: Epstein
description: Le Tempestaire, or the "storm-tamer," tells the story of a woman who visits the local storm-tamer to ensure the safety of her lover who is out at sea. The film manipulates time by slowing down and reversing its images of the stormy seas.
subject: French impressionism; photogénie; experimental

title: Les Feux de la mer
creator: Epstein
description: Epstein's documentary about lighthouses and lighthouse keepers; last of the Breton films, it was commissioned by the United Nations.
subject: documentary

title: La Terra Trema
creator: Visconti
description: A five-part film that tells the stories of Sicilian fishermen and their struggles, it's considered a key neorealist film and exhibits many characteristics such as the non-professional actors.
subject: neorealism; non-professional cast;

title: Late Spring
creator: Ozu
description: A film about a father and his widowed daughter. Set in the coastal town of Kamakura, south of Tokyo, the film was primarily shot in Kamakura and Chigasaki.
subject: shomingeki
